channel.title: Public Notices at U.S. EPA
channel.description: Updated Public Notices at U.S. EPA content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Public Notice: Response to Comments and Final Class VI Permit IL-115-6A-0001
item.description:
Contact Information

This page will be removed
Monday, May 8, 2017. 

Email, fax or mail your comments to:
  • Andrew Greenhagen (greenhagen.andrew @epa.gov)
    U.S. EPA Region 5
    Mailcode WU-16J
    77 W. Jackson Blvd.
    Chicago, IL 60604-3590
    Phone: 312-353-7648

Summary
EPA determined that there should be no impact to drinking water supplies as a result of injection via these wells.  EPA determined that public comments submitted did not demonstrate deficiency of the application based on UIC program requirements.  Public comments are addressed in the Response to Comments (below).  EPA made changes to the draft permit based on actual construction.  Therefore, the final major modified permit is issued to Archer Daniels Midland.

​Program/Statute:  Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) Underground Injection Control (UIC)

Applicant/Respondent(s): Archer Daniels Midland

Action:  Final Class VI injection well permit modification

Permit or application number:  Final Class VI Permit IL-115-6A-0001

Past Public Notice

November 2016
Public Notice: Proposed Permit Modification for ADM Class VI Well in Decatur, Ill.

Effective Date: March 6, 2017

Final Modified Permit Attachments

  • Response to Comments for Draft Modified Class VI Permit Issued to Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) (PDF)(23 pp, 509 K, January 2017)
    EPA’s response to comments on the draft permit modification for IL-115-6A-0001 in Macon County, Ill.
  • ADM Final Modified Permit Signed (PDF)(27 pp, 321 K, January 2017)
    EPA’s final permit modification for Archer Daniels Midland’s Class VI well in Macon County, Ill.
item.dc:creator: ypina
